channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What to Know About the ICE Shooting, and a Rare Climate Pledge from China
item.description: Plus, how big was Jimmy Kimmel’s first night back?

item.title: Sarkozy Found Guilty of Conspiracy to Seek L
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy, former president of France, was sentenced to five years in prison over a plot to fund his election bid with help from the government ...

item.title: What We Know About the Shooting at a Dallas ICE Facility
item.description: One detainee was killed and two others were wounded after a gunman opened fire on Wednesday. The gunman died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel’s Return Draws 6.2 Million Viewers, Ratings Show
item.description: The first episode of “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” since it was suspended last week by Disney attracted nearly four times as much as its average viewership.

item.title: China’s top car exporter Chery gains in Hong Kong debut
item.description: Chery has remained China’s top exporting brand every year since 2003. Russia, the Middle East and South America are among its top overseas sales marke...

item.title: Exclusive: Touring Capital, founded by ex-M12 and SoftBank investors, closes $330 million first fund
item.description: Founded in 2023, Touring Capital has now closed its first fund at $330 million, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: Apple admits some of its in-store chargers are scuffing the new iPhone 17 Pro, adding fuel to users’ durability concerns
item.description: Apple went for aluminum over titanium for this year's "Pro" iPhones, and this appears to be one of the trade-offs.

item.title: Times Reporters Answer Your Vaccine Questions
item.description: We received hundreds of queries about efficacy, safety, cost and access.

item.title: Everyone agrees stocks are suspiciously high. And everyone agrees they’re going higher anyway
item.description: The party is likely to continue despite the fact that the U.S. stock markets are dependent on the fate of just seven—or maybe even just one—company.

item.title: Bessent says New York can ‘drop dead’ if it elects Mamdani and ever needs a bailout
item.description: Bessent seemed determined to drive his warning home: "You can't enact policies like this and expect to be bailed out."

item.title: Sarkozy Found Guilty of Conspiracy to Seek L
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy, former president of France, was sentenced to five years in prison over a plot to fund his election bid with help from the government ...

item.title: South Korea’s New Tattoo Law Legalizes the Practice
item.description: For years, tattoo artists had to work in underground studios or windowless backrooms. They may soon be able to practice their craft in the open.

item.title: How Cities Are Beating the Heat
item.description: The world is hot — and only getting hotter. We looked at what places around the globe are doing to keep cool.

item.title: Denmark Briefly Closes More Airports After Unexplained Drone Sightings
item.description: Authorities shut a major airport for the second time in days. They did not say who was behind the incident, but European governments are on alert afte...

item.title: Map: 6.3-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Venezuela
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.
